page.title: 19LONGFORD W.I. - 1985
page.content: The Women's Institute still plays a very active part in the life of Longford village. It has 28 members. Some of our members are elderly; many are the wives of farmers. We are hoping to recruit some younger ones. Next year is our 60th anniversary, of which we are very proud. We meet in the Pump Room (at the Pump House) once a month. In the summer we meet in the evenings, in the winter in the afternoons. We have varied speakers with subjects from Gardens to Alternative Medicine. Every year we have a charity event. Last year we raised Â£332 for the Derby Scanner appeal. We still make jam and do crafts, but we have widened our scope to include games, sports, arts and more controversial subjects.
